description: Expression profiling of T98G cancer cells in growth-arrest induced by 3 days of either serum deprivation or contact inhibition. Results show that targets of the p130- E2F4 repressor complex are downregulated under the two growth-arrest conditions.

title: DNA damage from ultraviolet and ionizing radiation effect on peripheral blood lymphocytes
description: Analysis of peripheral blood lymphocytes exposed to ultraviolet (10 J/m^2) or ionizing radiation (5 Gy). Lymphocytes obtained from 15 healthy individuals from ages 21 to 36 years and immortalized with Epstein-Barr virus. Results provide insight into transcriptional response to DNA damage.

title: Metabolic syndrome response to exercise intervention (HG-95A)
description: Analysis of skeletal muscle from overweight males with metabolic syndrome. Individuals subjected to chronic exercise training. Muscles examined prior to training, and after 1 and 14 days of recovery following 9 months training. Provides insight into effects of exercise intervention.

title: Ewing family tumor histogenetic origin
description: Human embryonic kidney cells HEK293 transfected with the Ewing family tumor (EFT)-specific EWS-FLI1 fusion protein to investigate the histogenetic origin of EFTs. The observed EFT-specific gene expression profile supports the concept of a neural crest and endothelial origin of EFT stem cells.

title: Whole blood RNA isolation and leukocyte RNA purification: comparison of methods
description: Comparison of RNA isolation from whole blood using the PAXgene system to that from leukocytes using the buffy coat procedure.  Blood of healthy subjects and trauma patients examined.  Results indicate that RNA isolated from whole blood produced more noise than that from leukocytes.

title: Ewing family tumor cells: effect of transfection
description: Analysis of Ewing family tumor (EFT) cell line A673 response to interleukin-2 (IL-2) transfection to assess possible undesirable effects (e.g. tumor stimulation) of in vitro manipulation. Results impact the potential use of IL-2 transfection as an in vivo immunotherapy for EFT patients.

title: Kaposi sarcoma-associated herpesvirus infection of primary human dermal endothelial cells
description: Primary human dermal endothelial cells (HDMEC) were infected with isolated Kaposi sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV) for 7 days. Infection of HDVECs with KSHV results in upregulation of lymphatic lineage-specific genes and downregulation of blood vascular genes.

title: Skeletal myoblast cell line KM109 differentiation: time course (I)
description: Expression profiling of primary myoblast cell line KM109 obtained from muscle biopsy of a healthy individual and induced to differentiate by serum deprivation.  Cells examined at various time points up to 14 days following serum deprivation.  Results provide insight into late myogenesis.

title: Skeletal myoblast cell line KM109 differentiation: time course (I, dye-swap)
description: Expression profiling of primary myoblast cell line KM109 obtained from muscle biopsy of a healthy individual and induced to differentiate by serum deprivation. Cells examined at various time points up to 14 days following serum deprivation. Results provide insight into late myogenesis.

title: Skeletal myoblast cell line KM109 differentiation: time course (II)
description: Expression profiling of primary myoblast cell line KM109 obtained from muscle biopsy of a healthy individual and induced to differentiate by serum deprivation. Cells examined at various time points up to 14 days following serum deprivation. Results provide insight into late myogenesis.

title: Skeletal myoblast cell line KM109 differentiation: time course (II, dye-swap)
description: Expression profiling of primary myoblast cell line KM109 obtained from muscle biopsy of a healthy individual and induced to differentiate by serum deprivation. Cells examined at various time points up to 14 days following serum deprivation. Results provide insight into late myogenesis.

title: Familial combined hyperlipidemia
description: Expression profiling of lymphoblastic cell lines derived from the peripheral blood lymphocytes of patients with familial combined hyperlipidemia (FCHL), the most common form of genetically determined dyslipidemia.  Results provide insight into the pathophysiology of FCHL.

title: Diabetic nephropathy
description: Comparison of glomeruli from kidneys with diabetic nephropathy (DN) and glomeruli from kidneys of healthy individuals. Progression of DN may be due to diminished tissue repair capability.

title: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells and the effect of exercise
description: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) were isolated from blood samples taken from healthy male subjects before, immediately after, and 60 minutes after 30 minutes of exercise. Brisk activation and deactivation of genes associated with stress, inflammation, and tissue repair observed.

title: Macular degeneration and dermal fibroblast response to sublethal oxidative stress
description: Expression profiling of dermal fibroblasts from patients with macular degeneration.  Fibroblasts subjected to sublethal oxidative stress.  This study tests the hypothesis that patients with macular degeneration have an abnormal response to cellular injury in sites other than the eye.

title: Radiation therapy toxicity association with abnormal transcriptional response to DNA damage
description: Analysis of UV and IR irradiated lymphoblastoid cell lines derived from the peripheral blood of patients with acute radiation toxicity.  Samples taken 2 months after the completion of radiation therapy.  Results provide insight into the role of the response to DNA damage in radiation toxicity.

title: Bone marrow prolonged storage effects
description: Analysis of impact of pre-analytical handling of bone marrow (BM). Time delays of 0, 24, or 48 hours between sample aspiration and RNA extraction examined. Storage of BM has dramatic effects on mRNA expression of individual transcripts.

title: Rhabdomyosarcoma and Ewing's sarcoma comparison
description: Comparison of gene expression in 12 pediatric rhabdomyosarcomas (RMS) to that in 11 pediatric Ewing's sarcomas (EWS).   3 embryonic and 9 alveolar RMS tumors examined.  RMS and EWS appear similar in routine histology.  Results identify expression profiles that distinguish RMS from EWS.

title: Kidney transplant response to calcineurin inhibitor-free immunosuppression using sirolimus
description: Analysis of kidneys from adult renal transplant recipients subjected to calcineurin inhibitor-free immunosuppression using sirolimus. Patients treated with sirolimus have a lower prevalence of chronic allograft nephropathy compared to those treated with cyclosporine, a calcineurin inhibitor.

title: Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus LANA overexpression in B lymphoid cells: time course
description: Expression profiling of B lymphoid cell lines overexpressing the latency-associated nuclear antigen (LANA) of Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus. B cells made to express LANA from a tetracycline inducible promoter.  Expression examined at various time points up to 48 hours after induction.

title: Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus and Epstein-Barr virus infected cell lines
description: Expression profiling of cell lines BCBL-1 and BC-3 infected by Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV), Raji infected by the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), and BC-1 infected by both viruses.  Results identify expression patterns specific to KSHV-infected primary effusion lymphoma derived cells.

title: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane-associated genes in breast cancer cell line MCF-7
description: Identification of genes whose mRNA are translated from the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) in the breast cancer cell line MCF-7.  Secreted and membrane-bound proteins are preferentially translated in the ER.  Results provide insight into the association of membrane-bound proteins and breast cancer.

title: Bronchoalveolar lavage cells of lung transplant recipients with acute rejection
description: Expression profiling of bronchoalveolar lavage cells of lung transplant recipients with acute rejection. Rejection status determined from biopsies. Results identify possible gene markers of lung transplant rejection.

title: MSigDB MIR
description: Gene sets that contain genes that share a 3'-UTR microRNA binding motif

title: MSigDB CGP
description: Gene sets represent expression signatures of genetic and chemical perturbations

title: BioGRID
description: Database of Protein, Chemical, and Genetic Interactions

title: IntAct
description: Molecular interaction database

title: MINT
description: The molecular interaction database

title: MIPS
description: Mammalian protein-protein interaction database

title: Jaspar
description: Collections of transcription factor DNA-binding preferences

etype.title: TF binding
etype.description: Shared upstream tanscription factor binding motifs
